==Availability==
==Availability==
â
The phone is expected to be sold [[SIM lock|SIM-unlocked]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-gets-priced-sim-free-19189361/ |title=Galaxy Nexus gets priced SIM-free |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> and hardware-unlocked (unlocked bootloader, allowing [[Rooting (Android OS)|root access]]),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/24/motorola-razr-open-for-unlocked-bootloader-business-if-the-carr/ |title=Motorola RAZR open for unlocked bootloader business, if the carrier says so |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.handtec.co.uk/product.php/5527/samsung-galaxy-nexus-16gb--sim-free-unlocked- |title=Buy Samsung Galaxy Nexus 16GB (SIM Free/Unlocked) Reviews |publisher=Handtec.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/14/can-the-motorola-droid-razr-compete-with-the-galaxy-nexus/ |title=Can the Motorola Droid RAZR Compete with the Galaxy Nexus? |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-14 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/18/motorola-droid-razr-shipping-with-locked-bootloader/ |title=Motorola Droid RAZR Shipping with Locked Bootloader |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-18 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> following the tradition of the Nexus phones: [[Nexus One]]<ref>{{cite web|author=K-Rivera |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/smartphones/htc-nexus-one-by/4505-6452_7-33906802.html |title=HTC Nexus One by Google Review - Watch CNET's Video Review |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zdnet.com/blog/cell-phones/buying-the-nexus-one-unlocked-is-probably-the-best-choice/2879 |title=Buying the Nexus One unlocked is probably the best choice |publisher=ZDNet |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> and [[Nexus S]].<ref>{{cite web|author=ghileman |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/smartphones/samsung-nexus-s-at/4505-6452_7-34431171.html |title=Samsung Nexus S Review - Watch CNET's Video Review |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref>
+
The phone is expected to be sold [[SIM lock|SIM-unlocked]]<ref>http://www.amazon.co.uk/Samsung-I9250-Galaxy-Nexus-Mobile/dp/B005XYU45E</ref><ref>http://www.expansys-usa.com/google-nexus-prime-android-smartphone-unlocked-16gb-224148/</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-gets-priced-sim-free-19189361/ |title=Galaxy Nexus gets priced SIM-free |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> and hardware-unlocked (unlocked bootloader, allowing [[Rooting (Android OS)|root access]]),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/24/motorola-razr-open-for-unlocked-bootloader-business-if-the-carr/ |title=Motorola RAZR open for unlocked bootloader business, if the carrier says so |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.handtec.co.uk/product.php/5527/samsung-galaxy-nexus-16gb--sim-free-unlocked- |title=Buy Samsung Galaxy Nexus 16GB (SIM Free/Unlocked) Reviews |publisher=Handtec.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/14/can-the-motorola-droid-razr-compete-with-the-galaxy-nexus/ |title=Can the Motorola Droid RAZR Compete with the Galaxy Nexus? |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-14 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/18/motorola-droid-razr-shipping-with-locked-bootloader/ |title=Motorola Droid RAZR Shipping with Locked Bootloader |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-18 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> following the tradition of the Nexus phones: [[Nexus One]]<ref>{{cite web|author=K-Rivera |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/smartphones/htc-nexus-one-by/4505-6452_7-33906802.html |title=HTC Nexus One by Google Review - Watch CNET's Video Review |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zdnet.com/blog/cell-phones/buying-the-nexus-one-unlocked-is-probably-the-best-choice/2879 |title=Buying the Nexus One unlocked is probably the best choice |publisher=ZDNet |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> and [[Nexus S]].<ref>{{cite web|author=ghileman |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/smartphones/samsung-nexus-s-at/4505-6452_7-34431171.html |title=Samsung Nexus S Review - Watch CNET's Video Review |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref>
The phone will be supported by the carrier [[NTT DoCoMo]] in Japan, where the variant sold there will be officially known as the [[:ja:SC-04D|SC-04D]] within the [[:ja:docomo NEXT series|docomo NEXT series]] of smartphone devices.
The phone will be supported by the carrier [[NTT DoCoMo]] in Japan, where the variant sold there will be officially known as the [[:ja:SC-04D|SC-04D]] within the [[:ja:docomo NEXT series|docomo NEXT series]] of smartphone devices.
